decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells, card draw, and removal, while utilizing Kaheera as a companion for additional value. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, while maintaining card advantage with Meticulous Archive and Consult the Star Charts. The mana base provides flexibility and consistency, allowing the player to efficiently cast their spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and outvalue the opponent with powerful control elements.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Greasefang and Parhelion II combo, which allows for a powerful synergy between the two cards. The deck includes various cards to support and protect the combo, such as Formidable Speaker, Bitter Triumph, and Witherbloom Command. Additionally, the deck includes cards for disruption and control, like Thoughtseize and Cache Grab. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with the power of Greasefang and Parhelion II.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Knight-Errant of Eos, Venerated Loxodon, and Warden of the Inner Sky to pressure opponents and deal damage efficiently. Cards like Portable Hole and Gleeful Demolition help to control the board and remove threats, while cards like Novice Inspector and Thraben Inspector provide early game advantage and card draw. The deck also includes lands like Inspiring Vantage and Sacred Foundry to ensure consistent mana production for the aggressive curve of the deck.

The focus of this UW Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal, and card draw, while maintaining control of the game with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also utilizes cards like Consult the Star Charts and March of Otherworldly Light to manipulate the board and generate card advantage. The inclusion of the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard provides additional synergy and a potential boost to creatures. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through careful resource management and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing the synergies between Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to generate a powerful combo that allows for a swift victory. It also includes disruption elements such as Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand, while Formidable Speaker and Voice of Victory provide support for the combo strategy. The inclusion of various lands and utility cards ensures consistent mana production and flexibility in gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with its combo potential.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Archon of Emeria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer to quickly close out the game. Using a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy that can quickly turn the tide of the game in your favor.

This deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence through efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic. It also utilizes disruption tools like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria to slow down opponents. Collected Company helps to generate card advantage and put more threats on the battlefield. Skyclave Apparition serves as removal for problematic permanents. Elspeth, Storm Slayer provides a powerful finisher option. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently with a mix of creatures and disruption.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. It also utilizes mana dorks like Llanowar Elves to ramp up and play powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Preacher of the Schism. The inclusion of cards like Culling Ritual and Maelstrom Pulse helps to deal with problematic artifacts and enchantments. Overall, the deck aims to control the game by removing threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan while establishing its own board presence.

The main focus of this Pioneer Aggro Red Deck Wins is to overwhelm the opponent with fast creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By utilizing low-cost creatures and powerful burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, along with the ability to pump up creatures with Monstrous Rage and Emberheart Challenger, this deck aims to control the board and push for a fast victory. The inclusion of cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Sunspine Lynx allows for additional damage output, while cards like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins provide additional resources and utility.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to clear blockers and finish off the opponent. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection through spells like Academic Dispute and Consider to maintain tempo and find key pieces. With a mix of creatures and spells that can deal direct damage to the opponent, this deck aims to close out games swiftly and aggressively.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and managing resources efficiently. It includes powerful control tools such as counterspells, board wipes, and card draw, along with a utility land package to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion provides additional value and synergizes well with the deck's control game plan. The deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent with precise decision-making and strategic plays, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of removal, card advantage, and powerful threats.

The main concept of this Izzet Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, bouncing threats back to their hand, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. The deck utilizes various counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw to disrupt opponents' game plan while deploying threats like Gran-Gran and Cori-Steel Cutter to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements, allowing the player to cast spells efficiently and consistently. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and control the tempo of the game.

The deck focuses on disruption and removal to control the opponent's board while generating value through efficient creatures and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while creatures like Sentinel of the Nameless City and Ouroboroid provide a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of land destruction spells like Culling Ritual and Boseiju, Who Endures adds another layer of disruption to the deck's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of disruption and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Merfolk creatures to quickly build a board presence and beat down the opponent with aggressive attacks. The deck includes synergies such as the interaction between Master of Waves and Elemental tokens, as well as the potential to generate extra mana with Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx. Merfolk tribal synergies and tempo plays with Merfolk Trickster add additional depth to the strategy, while cards like Deeproot Pilgrimage and Hall of Storm Giants provide additional utility and protection. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggro game plan.

The main concept of this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress while efficiently removing threats with Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Qarsi Revenant to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The main focus of this aggressive Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of cheap burn spells, efficient creatures with haste, and pump effects. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to chip away at the opponent's life total. With a mix of direct damage spells and aggressive creatures, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently before they have a chance to stabilize.
